page.title: 15WILD FLOWERS
page.content: I know of 70 different varieties of wild flowers in Kilchrenan. They vary from the very common i.e. the butter- cup and daisy to the rare and beautiful orchids of which there are many varieties and these have now become protected species. We are lucky that Kilchrenan is a conservation area which means that we are not allowed to pick the wild- flowers such as the bluebell, primrose, for-get-me-not and violet because they are becoming extinct in other parts of Britain. You can tell the condition of the ground by the flowers which are growing on it such as the wild iris and bobcotten which grow on boggy land, the speedwell and foxglove which grow on dry and rocky ground, and the marsh marigold and wateravon which grow near rivers.
